text: How worrisome is this new strain?

elements.text: How worrisome is this new strain?

text:
It seems like it probably is indeed 50-70% more transmissible.
and that mean r effective. So each person is going to spread it to more people.
(So its not 50-70% more cases it is an expodintial number of more cases)

Though its probably not  more  likely to kill you / leave you permanently disabled.
but rolling the dice much more as often is going to lead to a lot more deaths and disability.

text: <@U6A936746> - so, would this mean that the Moderna and Pfizer vaccines aren't as effective anymore?

elements.text: - so, would this mean that the Moderna and Pfizer vaccines aren't as effective anymore?

text:
They probably are as effective.
At least that is every statement i have heard.
There was also a statement from I think the chief scientist at Pfizer saying basically: “we are pretty sure the vaccine should still work just as well. If it doesn’t we expect that we can create a new vaccine for any mutation in about 6 weeks”

text:
The UK is getting wrecked right now.
Many more new cases per day per captia than the US.
(though that has happened several times before)

Much of the UK is basically in lockdown (what they call Tier 4).
Further schools have been closed for christmas.
Cases are still going up very rapidly.

Though there are compounding factors.
the large amount of Tier 4 stated on the 26th, and so we are still seeing many test results coming back cases that were caught before then.
Still prior to that large amounts of the UK were on Tier 3 which is still hospitality closed.
And it was Christmas, and there was some relaxation of rules *and* people are terrible.
